intro: Decaspermum parvifolium, commonly known as the small-leaved decaspermum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its small, trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically pale yellow or greenish in color. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and hardy nature, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens in suitable climates.
